full_content.content: Common reasons your Bosch dryer needs drum roller replacement
The most common reasons your Bosch dryer needs drum roller replacement are a worn drum support roller, broken drum belt or a worn drum bearing.
We can help! Our service technicians have repaired over
Bosch dryers. We can fix yours no matter where you bought it.
Most common repairs needed to fix a Bosch dryer

As a drum support roller wears out, your dryer will begin to noise such as clunking sounds or metallic grinding noises. Clunking noises are caused when the roller wheel flattens out and the drum hits flat places on the roller wheel as it spins. When the worn drum support roller fails to keep the drum in place as the drum rotates, you may hear grinding noises as the drum rubs against metal in the cabinet. When your dryer makes noise, schedule service and have a Sears Home Services Repair Expert examine and fix the dryer.
How to replace a dryer drum support roller

When a drum roller wears out on your dryer, check the condition of the drum belt. A worn drum belt can put extra pressure on the drum roller and cause the drum roller to wear out prematurely. The drum belt should fit snugly around the dryer drum. The idler pulley exerts tension on the belt so it stays tight and spins the drum properly. As the belt wears out, it can stretch and get loose so the drum may vibrate and not spin properly. When your dryer isn’t spinning as it should, have a Sears Home Services Technician visit your home and fix the dryer.
How to replace a dryer drum belt

When the drum roller needs replacing in your dryer, check for a worn drum bearing. A worn drum bearing can put extra strain on the drum roller and cause premature failure. The drum bearing ensures that the drum rolls smoothly when the bearing is working properly. When the drum bearing is worn out, the drum won't spin smoothly so the drum roller will often fail quickly because the drum exerts more pressure on the roller. Have a Sears Home Services Technician replace the drum bearing and drum roller when the drum isn't spinning smoothly.
How to replace a dryer drum glide bearing
What to expect when you experience a Bosch dryer drum roller replacement issue
How is the drum roller replacement problem fixed?

Correcting most drum roller problems usually involves replacing the drum support roller, drum belt or drum bearing. However, there are many potential causes, so a thorough diagnosis is key to fixing the problem. An accurate diagnosis is essential to understanding how much the repair will be.
Sears Home Services recommendations for a dryer drum roller replacement

When the dryer needs drum roller replacement it can be for many reasons. To avoid replacing unneeded parts we recommend having a Sears Home Services professional perform diagnostic tests to identify the root cause of the problem. Our technicians are experienced at diagnosing all types of dryer failures.
What to look out for with a dryer drum roller replacement diagnosis

Diagnosing modern appliances without proper knowledge and training can be difficult. Without using proper diagnostic techniques, fixing your dryer problem will only be achieved through changing parts on a hunch. Appliances, especially in the last 10 years, have become extremely advanced, and many models have electronic parts that are difficult to test. DIY repairs on the latest appliance models are becoming increasingly difficult.
A banging or thumping Bosch dryer may suffer from worn-out drum rollers. While the blog suggests DIY swaps, it’s easy to misalign parts. For a seamless fix, consider
. Proper roller replacement restores smooth tumbling and cuts down on noise.
What our customers say about us
With more than 1.3 Million 5 Star Reviews, you don't have to take our word for it

full_content.content: How do I replace the drum rollers in my Bosch dryer?
To replace the drum rollers, unplug the dryer, remove the drum, take out the old rollers, and install the new ones. Check that the drum rotates smoothly after the replacement.
What signs indicate my Bosch dryer drum rollers need replacement?
If your dryer makes a loud noise or the drum doesn’t spin smoothly, it could be due to worn-out drum rollers. Replace them to restore normal function.
How can I stop my Bosch dryer from making noise?
Check the drum rollers for wear. Replacing worn rollers should solve the noise issue.
Do I need special tools to replace drum rollers in a Bosch dryer?
You’ll need a screwdriver, pliers, socket set, work gloves and replacement rollers to complete the job. Refer to the dryer’s manual for specific instructions.

full_content.content: Deciphering Samsung Clothes Dryer Error Codes
Find the most common Samsung clothes dryer error codes and their solutions. Get professional help from Sears Home Services.
A dryer drum is the main interior component of a clothes dryer where clothes are placed to be dried. It rotates during the drying cycle, allowing heated air to circulate through the clothes.

A dryer filter, commonly known as a lint filter, is a component of a clothes dryer that captures lint and other debris from clothes during the drying process, preventing them from clogging the dryer vent.
A dryer pedestal is a platform that elevates a dryer off the ground, making it easier to load and unload laundry while also providing additional storage space in some models.

A dryer rack is an accessory for clothes dryers that provides a stationary platform to dry items without tumbling, ideal for delicate or bulky items, or shoes that might be damaged by the usual drying cycle.
Additional possible Bosch dryer symptoms you may experience
These dryer brands may also experience drum roller replacement

Speed Queen dryer drum roller replacement

Notice of Right to Opt Out of Sale/Sharing

This website uses cookies and other tracking technologies (“Cookies”) to serve targeted ads, enhance user experience, and to analyze user activity. Some Cookies may collect personal information that is used in a way that is considered a “Sale”, “Sharing”, or “Targeted Advertising” as those terms are defined under various state privacy laws. To opt out of Cookie based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising, please follow the instructions below. full_content.content: You can move the toggle above to the left to opt out of Cookie-based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising. Please note that your opt-out choice is specific to this website, browser, and device. If you access other Transformco websites, you will need to make your election for each. Also, if you clear your Cookies on this browser or use another browser or device, you may need to opt out again on this website.

Please note: Opting out may affect our ability to personalize your experience on this website, though we may use Cookies that do not include Sales, Sharing, or Targeted Advertising. You may still receive non-personalized advertisements on other sites or personalized ads that may be based on information processed before you opted out.

This website recognizes the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize certain browser-based opt-out preference signals. We will process the GPC signal as a request to opt out. To process your request through GPC, you must use a browser or browser extension that supports the signal and turn it on for each browser and device you use.
